item.title: Emergent exchange-driven giant magnetoelastic coupling in a correlated itinerant ferromagnet
item.author: Carolina A. MarquesLuke C. RhodesPeter Wahl
item.content:encoded:
Magnetostructural changes are usually small and driven by spin–orbit coupling. Now, electron–lattice coupling enhanced by exchange interactions is shown to produce giant magnetostriction in a correlated ferromagnet.

Carolina A. MarquesLuke C. RhodesPeter Wahl

Nature Physics

item.title: Experimental demonstration of breakeven for a compact fermionic encoding
item.author: Ramil NigmatullinKévin HémeryHenrik Dreyer
item.content:encoded:
Digital quantum simulations of fermionic models have so far been based on the Jordan–Wigner encoding, which is computationally expensive. An alternative and more efficient encoding scheme is now demonstrated in a trapped-ion quantum computer.

Ramil NigmatullinKévin HémeryHenrik Dreyer

Nature Physics

item.title: Happy birthday quantum mechanics! I got a ticket to the ultimate physics party
item.author: Elizabeth Gibney
item.content:encoded:
Nature reporter joins hundreds of physicists on a remote island to celebrate Heisenberg’s enlightening trip there 100 years ago.

Elizabeth Gibney

Nature

item.title: Science diplomacy is in trouble
item.author: V. M. CastañoG. Violini
item.content:encoded:
Geopolitical tensions pose a threat to international collaborations and the democratization of science.

V. M. CastañoG. Violini

Nature Physics

item.title: Cheat-proof random numbers generated from quantum entanglement
item.author: Peter Brown
item.content:encoded:
A quantum random-number generator has been developed that uses classical cryptography to certify that its output was produced by a quantum process.

Peter Brown

Nature

item.title: A neutral-atom Hubbard quantum simulator in the cryogenic regime
item.author: Muqing XuLev Haldar KendrickMarkus Greiner
item.content:encoded:
A several-fold reduction in temperature is accomplished using a neutral-atom Hubbard quantum simulator by transforming a low-entropy product state into strongly correlated states of interest via dynamic control of the model parameters.

Muqing XuLev Haldar KendrickMarkus Greiner

Nature

item.title: Traceable random numbers from a non-local quantum advantage
item.author: Gautam A. KavuriJasper PalfreeLynden K. Shalm
item.content:encoded:
A study demonstrates a public generator of random numbers based on device-independent techniques, with the randomness being fully auditable and traceable.

Gautam A. KavuriJasper PalfreeLynden K. Shalm

Nature

item.title: Ultrasensitive single-ion electrometry in a magnetic field gradient
item.author: F. BonusC. KnappW. K. Hensinger
item.content:encoded:
Trapped ions are promising for electrometry but limited by their weak intrinsic spin coupling to electric fields. Now it is shown that using a magnetic field gradient enhances sensitivity and enables precise measurements across subhertz to kilohertz frequencies.

F. BonusC. KnappW. K. Hensinger

Nature Physics

item.title: Quantum physicists unveil most ‘trustworthy’ random-number generator yet
item.author: Davide Castelvecchi
item.content:encoded:
Upgraded system produces strings of random bits in a process that is fully traceable.

Davide Castelvecchi

Nature

item.title: Extreme-ultraviolet spatiotemporal vortices via high harmonic generation
item.author: Rodrigo Martín-HernándezGuan GuiCarlos Hernández-García
item.content:encoded:
The generation of spatiotemporal optical vortices in the extreme-ultraviolet regime is demonstrated via high harmonic generation. Topologically coupled at the nanometre and attosecond domains, these light beams are attractive for exploring electronic dynamics in magnetic materials, chiral media and nanostructures.

Rodrigo Martín-HernándezGuan GuiCarlos Hernández-García

Nature Photonics

item.title: Peter Lax obituary: mathematician who pioneered computer-based solutions to real-world problems
item.author: Jeremy Berg
item.content:encoded:
The Abel prizewinner’s pragmatic approach to solving differential equations was influential across fields ranging from weather forecasting to starting nuclear chain reactions.

Jeremy Berg

Nature

item.title: Do our observations make reality happen?
item.author: Alyssa Ney
item.content:encoded:
Finally answering the most-vexed question in quantum theory might mean redefining what is real.

Alyssa Ney

Nature

item.title: Harnessing micro-Fabry–Pérot reference cavities in photonic integrated circuits
item.author: Haotian ChengChao XiangPeter T. Rakich
item.content:encoded:
Self-injection locking of an on-chip laser to a milimetre-scale vacuum-gap Fabry–Pérot cavity is demonstrated, with a phase noise of –97 dBc Hz–1 at a 10-kHz offset frequency and a fractional frequency stability of 5 × 10−13 at 10 ms, enabling next-generation high-performance integrated systems.

Haotian ChengChao XiangPeter T. Rakich

Nature Photonics

item.title: Quantum computers tackle unexplored particle physics
item.author: Davide Castelvecchi
item.content:encoded:
Two quantum-simulation experiments make a step towards understanding the forces between elementary particles.

Davide Castelvecchi

Nature

item.title: Controlling magnetization dynamics in a single step
item.author: Edoardo Baldini
item.content:encoded:
A new method that uses light-induced superconducting quenches to generate abrupt, sub-picosecond, local magnetic field steps has potential applications ranging from spintronics to spectroscopy of quantum materials.

Edoardo Baldini

Nature Photonics

item.title: Experimentally probing Landauer’s principle in the quantum many-body regime
item.author: Stefan AimetMohammadamin TajikJens Eisert
item.content:encoded:
Landauer’s principle connects entropy and energy dissipation in non-equilibrium processes. An experiment now uses this principle to measure entropy production in a Bose gas to resolve contributions from correlations and dissipation.

Stefan AimetMohammadamin TajikJens Eisert

Nature Physics

item.title: Ultrafast tunable photonic-integrated extended-DBR Pockels laser
item.author: Anat SiddharthSimone BianconiTobias J. Kippenberg
item.content:encoded:
A turn-key-operable hybrid integrated Pockels laser based on an external distributed Bragg waveguide grating reflector fabricated in a wafer-scale thin-film lithium niobate on insulator platform is demonstrated, with a tuning efficiency of over 550 MHz V–1, tuning rates reaching the exahertz per second, and a high output power of 15 mW.

Anat SiddharthSimone BianconiTobias J. Kippenberg

Nature Photonics

item.title: Trump moves to slash NSF: why are the proposed budget cuts so big?
item.author: Dan Garisto
item.content:encoded:
Major US science funder could lose more than half its budget — and researchers are reeling.

Dan Garisto

Nature

item.title: Integrated photonic source of Gottesman–Kitaev–Preskill qubits
item.author: M. V. LarsenJ. E. BourassaD. H. Mahler
item.content:encoded:
An ultra-low-loss integrated photonic chip fabricated on a customized multilayer silicon nitride 300-mm wafer platform, coupled over fibre with high-efficiency photon number resolving detectors, is used to generate Gottesman–Kitaev–Preskill qubit states.

M. V. LarsenJ. E. BourassaD. H. Mahler

Nature

item.title: Making robust integrated photonic qubits
item.author: N/A
item.content:encoded:
High-performance photonic integrated chips have been demonstrated that generate robust optical quantum bits called Gottesman–Kitaev–Preskill qubits. One such chip has been used to realize qubit states, reconstruct the quantum features of these states and verify the quality of the qubits.

Nature

item.title: Observation of string breaking on a (2 + 1)D Rydberg quantum simulator
item.author: Daniel González-CuadraMajd HamdanAlexei Bylinskii
item.content:encoded:
A quantum simulation of a (2 + 1)-dimensional lattice gauge theory is carried out on a quantum computer working with neutral atoms trapped by optical tweezers in a Kagome geometry.

Daniel González-CuadraMajd HamdanAlexei Bylinskii

Nature

item.title: Simulation of matter–antimatter creation on quantum platforms
item.author: Michele Burrello
item.content:encoded:
Two-dimensional quantum platforms have simulated a process in particle physics called string breaking that generates matter–antimatter pairs.

Michele Burrello

Nature

item.title: Visualizing dynamics of charges and strings in (2 + 1)D lattice gauge theories
item.author: T. A. CochranB. JobstP. Roushan
item.content:encoded:
In a quantum simulation of a (2+1)D lattice gauge theory using a superconducting quantum processor, the dynamics of strings reveal the transition from deconfined to confined excitations as the effective electric field is increased.

T. A. CochranB. JobstP. Roushan

Nature

item.title: A soft-clamped topological waveguide for phonons
item.author: Xiang XiIlia ChernobrovkinAlbert Schliesser
item.content:encoded:
A substantial reduction of losses in a phononic waveguide can be achieved by soft clamping, through which phonons can be guided through very sharp turns with losses accounting for less than one phonon in a million.

Xiang XiIlia ChernobrovkinAlbert Schliesser

Nature

item.title: Experimental quantum-enhanced kernel-based machine learning on a photonic processor
item.author: Zhenghao YinIris AgrestiPhilip Walther
item.content:encoded:
A quantum kernel estimation by which feature data points are evaluated through the unitary evolution of two-boson Fock states is experimentally demonstrated on a photonic integrated processor. This model provides enhanced accuracy with respect to commonly used classical methods for several classification tasks.

Zhenghao YinIris AgrestiPhilip Walther

Nature Photonics

item.title: Precision is not limited by the second law of thermodynamics
item.author: Florian MeierYuri MinoguchiMarcus Huber
item.content:encoded:
Clock precision is thought to be fundamentally limited by entropy production in out-of-equilibrium systems. A theoretical work now introduces a quantum clock design where precision grows exponentially with dissipation.

Florian MeierYuri MinoguchiMarcus Huber

Nature Physics

item.title: Observing anyonization of bosons in a quantum gas
item.author: Sudipta DharBotao WangHanns-Christoph Nägerl
item.content:encoded:
Emergent anyonic correlations via spin–charge separation are observed in a one-dimensional strongly interacting quantum gas, enabling the exploration of non-equilibrium anyonic phenomena in a highly controllable setting.

Sudipta DharBotao WangHanns-Christoph Nägerl

Nature

item.title: Unconventional solitonic high-temperature superfluorescence from perovskites
item.author: Melike BilirogluMustafa TüreKenan Gundogdu
item.content:encoded:
Exciton–lattice interactions suppress thermal noise through vibration isolation, enabling unconventional solitonic superfluorescence at unusually high temperatures in lead halide perovskites.

Melike BilirogluMustafa TüreKenan Gundogdu

Nature

item.title: Electrical switching of a p-wave magnet
item.author: Qian SongSrdjan StavrićRiccardo Comin
item.content:encoded:
Experimental observations and theoretical analysis provide evidence that the spin polarization of the spin-spiral type II multiferroic NiI2 exhibits p-wave magnetism and its spin chirality is related to ferroelectric polarization, which can be electrically controlled.

Qian SongSrdjan StavrićRiccardo Comin

Nature

item.title: Critical fermions are universal embezzlers
item.author: Lauritz van LuijkAlexander StottmeisterHenrik Wilming
item.content:encoded:
One-dimensional critical fermionic models play an important role in many-body physics. Now it has been shown that any entangled state can be extracted from a bipartitioned critical fermion chain with an arbitrarily small change to the initial state.

Lauritz van LuijkAlexander StottmeisterHenrik Wilming

Nature Physics

item.title: Scaling and logic in the color code on a superconducting quantum processor
item.author: N. LacroixA. BourassaK. J. Satzinger
item.content:encoded:
N. LacroixA. BourassaK. J. Satzinger

Nature

item.title: Optomechanical self-organization in a mesoscopic atom array
item.author: Jacquelyn HoYue-Hui LuDan M. Stamper-Kurn
item.content:encoded:
Investigating mesoscopic systems can offer insights into the crossover between few-body and many-body regimes. Atomic arrays inside an optical cavity are now shown to enable the controlled study of critical properties on mesoscopic scales.

Jacquelyn HoYue-Hui LuDan M. Stamper-Kurn

Nature Physics

item.title: Chirality-induced quantum non-reciprocity
item.author: Zimo ZhangZhongxiao XuHeng Shen
item.content:encoded:
Chirality-induced quantum non-reciprocity of cross-channel correlations is demonstrated in a rubidium vapour system by flipping the flow direction of one of the circularly polarized laser beams. It can be extended to multicolour sidebands with Floquet engineering.

Zimo ZhangZhongxiao XuHeng Shen

Nature Photonics

item.title: Harvard researchers devastated as Trump team cuts nearly 1,000 grants
item.author: Dan Garisto
item.content:encoded:
Nature talks to scientists about an uncertain future as the US government lays siege to their university.

Dan Garisto

Nature

item.title: Signatures of chiral superconductivity in rhombohedral graphene
item.author: Tonghang HanZhengguang LuLong Ju
item.content:encoded:
Tonghang HanZhengguang LuLong Ju

Nature

item.title: Long optical coherence times in a rare-earth-doped antiferromagnet
item.author: Masaya HiraishiZachary H. RobertsJevon J. Longdell
item.content:encoded:
Solid-state quantum devices can suffer from decoherence caused by fluctuating electron spins in the surrounding material. Operating in a regime where the electron spins become magnetically ordered produces substantially longer coherence times.

Masaya HiraishiZachary H. RobertsJevon J. Longdell

Nature Physics

item.title: Quantum neural networks form Gaussian processes
item.author: Diego García-MartínMartín LaroccaM. Cerezo
item.content:encoded:
The connection between classical neural networks and Gaussian processes is a fundamental result in machine learning. It has now been shown that many quantum neural networks converge to Gaussian processes, enabling their use for regression tasks.

Diego García-MartínMartín LaroccaM. Cerezo

Nature Physics

item.title: Single-photon superabsorption in CsPbBr3 perovskite quantum dots
item.author: Simon C. BoehmeTan P. T. NguyenGabriele Rainò
item.content:encoded:
Greatly enhanced light absorption is reported in large perovskite quantum dots by realizing a transition with a giant oscillator strength at the optical bandgap.

Simon C. BoehmeTan P. T. NguyenGabriele Rainò

Nature Photonics

item.title: Cross-polarized stimulated Brillouin scattering-empowered photonics
item.author: Mingming NieJonathan MusgraveShu-Wei Huang
item.content:encoded:
Cross-polarized stimulated Brillouin scattering and its integration with quadratic nonlinearity is studied in lithium niobate, which enhanced photonic device performance in a reconfigurable stimulated Brillouin laser with 0.7-Hz narrow linewidth and 40-nm tunability, an efficient coherent mode converter, and Brillouin-quadratic laser and frequency comb operational in near-infrared and visible bands.

Mingming NieJonathan MusgraveShu-Wei Huang

Nature Photonics

item.title: Daily briefing: The world’s first human bladder transplant
item.author: Flora Graham
item.content:encoded:
A 41-year-old man has become the first person to receive a bladder transplant in an eight-hour operation. Plus, a ‘minimalist’ approach to quantum computing and meet the dog who helps stop turtle poachers.

Flora Graham

Nature

item.title: Entanglement meets artificial intelligence in quantum sensors
item.author: Alice Sinatra
item.content:encoded:
The high precision of atomic sensors can be further enhanced by quantum correlations between atoms prepared in an entangled state through the use of artificial intelligence.

Alice Sinatra

Nature Physics

item.title: Single particle acts as a quantum computer to simulate molecules
item.author: Davide Castelvecchi
item.content:encoded:
A trapped ytterbium ion can be used to model complex changes in the energy levels of organic molecules interacting with light.

Davide Castelvecchi

Nature

item.title: The international measurement system beyond 2030
item.author: Wynand LouwGert Rietveld
item.content:encoded:
Measurements play a crucial role in our daily lives; and we rely on metrology to ensure that measurements are accurate and comparable. Celebrating the 150th anniversary of the beginning of the global measurement system, we look into its future.

Wynand LouwGert Rietveld

Nature Physics

item.title: Quantum error correction of qudits beyond break-even
item.author: Benjamin L. BrockShraddha SinghMichel H. Devoret
item.content:encoded:
Quantum error correction of a logical qutrit and ququart were experimentally realized beyond the break-even point with the Gottesman–Kitaev–Preskill bosonic code.

Benjamin L. BrockShraddha SinghMichel H. Devoret

Nature

item.title: Tunable vacuum-field control of fractional and integer quantum Hall phases
item.author: Josefine EnknerLorenzo GraziottoJérôme Faist
item.content:encoded:
Using a system to adjust the strength of cavity vacuum fields penetrating a Hall bar, a study describes the effect of the vacuum field of a cavity on electronic correlations in quantum Hall systems.

Josefine EnknerLorenzo GraziottoJérôme Faist

Nature

item.title: Bulk–spatiotemporal vortex correspondence in gyromagnetic zero-index media
item.author: Ruo-Yang ZhangXiaohan CuiC. T. Chan
item.content:encoded:
Realization of a gyromagnetic double-zero-index metamaterial results in unconventional optical and topological properties, suitable to be used for the generation of light pulses shaped as a vortex both in time and space.

Ruo-Yang ZhangXiaohan CuiC. T. Chan

Nature

item.title: Photon bunching in high-harmonic emission controlled by quantum light
item.author: Samuel LemieuxSohail A. JalilGiulio Vampa
item.content:encoded:
When high-harmonic emission from a ZnO crystal is perturbed with a bright squeezed vacuum beam, a comb of super-bunched high-order sidebands is created. This indicates photon bunching and the generation of a non-coherent state at the short wavelength.

Samuel LemieuxSohail A. JalilGiulio Vampa

Nature Photonics

item.title: Why bad philosophy is stopping progress in physics
item.author: Carlo Rovelli
item.content:encoded:
Theoretical physicists are in thrall to a misguided mindset that allows viable ideas to be advanced only by overturning what already exists.

Carlo Rovelli

Nature

item.title: Quantum cluster states engineered in three dimensions
item.author: Olivier Pfister
item.content:encoded:
The experimental realization of a 3D cluster quantum state paves the way for information processing employing quantum error correction.

Olivier Pfister

Nature Photonics

item.title: Twisting entangled photons on a chip
item.author: Filippo CardanoLorenzo Marrucci
item.content:encoded:
A programmable quantum chip has been developed that generates, manipulates, and launches five-dimensional entangled photons into free-space channels, encoded as optical vortex modes, thus bridging the worlds of integrated and free-space quantum photonics.

Filippo CardanoLorenzo Marrucci

Nature Photonics
